For students in the Canton Local Virtual Academy, your virtual online orientation, and the first day of class will take place on Monday, August 24th.

Orientation videos will be posted on the district webpage at 7 am on Monday, August 24th, and are viewable at any point during the day. Watching the online orientation videos on Monday is mandatory for all Virtual Academy students and families. No registration is required!

The videos will provide students and families with information on how to access online learning platforms. These pre-recorded videos will allow students and families to pause, follow instructions, and continue through the orientation/training.

Our Virtual Academy staff will know that the orientation videos have been viewed when we see that students have logged into the learning platform on Monday.

If you have a child in kindergarten through twelfth grade in your household who was receiving free or reduced-price meals while in school, your child is eligible for the Pandemic-Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) program to receive Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits as a result of the school closure.

What is P-EBT?
The federal Families First Coronavirus Response Act of 2020 provides a temporary program called Pandemic-Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT). P-EBT provides children in kindergarten through twelfth grade eligible for free or reduced-price meals with Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP, formerly known as food stamps) benefits. The program is administered by the Ohio Department of Job and Family Services and the Department is partnering with the Ohio Department of Education (ODE) to ensure children and families receive this important benefit.

For questions regarding P-EBT, please contact the ODJFS customer service line at 1-866-244-0071.

Learning packets with activities for this week and for the week of March 30 were sent home with students last week. If you need to pick up a packet for your child, Walker is open this week from 8:00-noon. Next week, our building will be closed due to the previously scheduled spring break.

In the next several days, you will be receiving either a phone call or a Remind message from your child’s teacher. Please take the time to answer their questions as it will help us plan for remote learning and enable us to better meet the needs of our students. Specifically, this will help us determine which students need an electronic device (per Mr. Milano’s phone call last evening).

While these are uncertain times, we do want to be proactive in planning learning that will continue to foster your child’s growth. Please continue to visit the Canton Local School District’s website at cantonlocal.org. More information will be forthcoming the week of March 30.
